content:
Everyone - In general, I think we should as few streams as possible in Zulip, since we have topics to help us sort messages. But, I am thinking of creating a "Community Chatter" stream (channel) where people can feel free to chat about what is happening in the lives outside of Backdrop, without feeling like they are off-topic.

Also, it would be place that users could opt out of, if they really just want to focus on Backdrop while they are here. At a minimum, we should (as @Jack suggested) get away from the "covid-19" topic title to something a little less distressing.

Any thoughts?
Or would folks rather keep everything in the General stream and just use a "Community Chat" topic?
It is possible for anyone to mute a given topic.

I think either way would work. If we create a new 'Community' stream, I'd suggest renaming 'General' to 'Backdrop'. I personally have muted a few topics that don't interest me so I'm not getting notifications (unless I'm mentioned by name), so that's certainly do-able if we keep an 'Off topic' topic in the General/Backdrop stream.

I loved the idea of changing "General" to "Backdrop" - so, I just went ahead and did it. I'm going to hold off a few more hours on creating a new stream and give others a chance to reply first. But, if there are not any objections, I'll create that stream later today.
If we create a 'Community' stream, I also suggest making it a default stream so new users are added there automatically.
whatever you guys want; i don't even know what you are talking about lolz; #backdropintheevening;

@BWPanda (Peter) that is an option. I was leaning towards keeping that channel as opt in, but I can totally see the logic in having it a default channel. It's very easy to get out of it.

Does anyone else have any thoughs about whether "community chat" should be an default channel or require folks to join it. (If it's not a default channel, then I would try to remind folks about it an a regular basis to make sure they know about it).

If it's not a default channel, then I would try to remind folks about it an a regular basis

That's why I suggested that, to avoid constant reminders :wink:
I don't have any hard preference on this; be it a topic or a stream, I'll most likely be monitoring both :slight_smile:
Geez somehow I lost a reply I tried to post here, TWICE
One more try! @StPaulTim I wasn't trying to change the COVID-19 topic name to something less alarming; I was trying to change the "Drupal 7.69 no longer supported" topic name!
because apparently that is more distressing to me lol
I support having both a COVID-19 topic AND other topics that are about the times we live in but with different, less distressing topics :)
Yes, especially since Drupal 7 is still supported until November 2021: https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/
Is it really Thursday? It doesn't feel like Thursday. #c19time
